Geneticists at Harvard University carried out research on ancient human remains. They found that hunter gatherers living in Spain up to 8,500 years ago had dark skin. It was not until 7,800 years ago when the first farmers migrated through Turkey that two key genes that provide lighter skin appeared

Swiss researchers measured the temperature of 'Hot Jupiter' HD 189733b. They found the temperature reaches up to 3,000C in the atmosphere. And wind speeds are in excess of 620 miles per hour. The findings were made using a novel technique relying on sodium signals.

The two chimpanzees, living at Stony Brook University, Long Island, are the first animals in history to be covered by a writ of habeas corpus, allowing their detention to be challenged. The decision by New York Supreme Court Justice Barbara Jaffe effectively recognises the chimpanzees as legal humans.
